alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Covington County through 515 PM CDT... At 500 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Opp to 9 miles northeast of Lockhart to 6 miles east of Florala. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Opp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
